title: Where is the best university to study law in the United Kingdom? - Quora

response.answer_text: UK's university offers range of law programmes at both undergraduate and postgraduate level. The following are some of the best and leading universities to study law in the United Kingdom. Best universities to study law in the UK: University of Cambridge - Faculty of Law offers BA Tripos Degree in Law, LLM Master of law (LLM), MCL Masters in Corporate Law and PhD Doctorate in Law. University of Oxford - Faculty of Law offers range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses which includes BA in Jurisprudence, BCL Bachelor of Civil Law, MSc in Law and Finance, DPhil in Law etc. London School of Economics and Political Science - Department of Law offers course includes LLB Bachelor of Laws, MSc, Law and Accounting, LLM Masters in Law, Executive LLM etc. UCl - Faculty of Law offers LLB Law, LLM Masters in Law and MPhil/PhD Law. University of Edinburgh - Edinburgh Law School offers LLB Law (Honours and Ordinary), LLM in Law, PhD in Law etc. King's College London - The Dickson Poon School of Law offers range of law courses including Law LLB, Law LLM and Law Research MPhil/PhD. Durham University - Durham Law School offers Law LLB and, Master of Law LLM etc. Queen Mary University of London - Queen Mary School of Law offers LLB Law, Master of Law LLM, PhD in Law and more. University of Glasgow - School of Law offers LLB Bachelor of Law, LLM Master of Law, LLM by Research and more. University of Manchester - School of Social Sciences offers Range of law courses including LLB Law, LLM Law, PhD in Law etc. Whether you're looking for undergraduate, postgraduate taught or postgraduate research degree law courses, these are leading universities to pursue law degree in UK.
If you exclude Scotland (which has its own legal system), then my personal top 10 in a very rough approximation of order would be: CambridgeOxfordUCLLSEDurhamManchesterKCLBristolWarwickQMW
